meanings.sent1: The farmer watched the playful gyte frolic in the meadow.
meanings.sent2: The gyte followed its mother closely as they grazed in the field.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous gyte managed to escape the pen and explore the farm.
meanings.sent4: The gyte's bleat echoed through the barn, signaling its presence.
meanings.sent5: The fluffy gyte nuzzled against the shepherd, seeking warmth.

meanings.definition: To bring forth young, especially sheep or goats
meanings.sent1: The ewe will gyte in the spring, adding new life to the flock.
meanings.sent2: The goat gyted twins, much to the delight of the farmer.
meanings.sent3: The sheep gyted with such enthusiasm that the other animals seemed impressed.
meanings.sent4: The farm resonated with the sounds of ewes gyting in the early morning.
meanings.sent5: The farmer eagerly awaited the moment when his sheep would gyte.
